title: Service Learning Design for Heritage Language Learners in Purpose-Specific Language Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Language Proficiency and Awareness of Cultural Identity
context.additional_context: Heritage learners are a group with prior knowledge and identity tied to language and culture, conducting projects in smartphone-based limited-technology environments

learning_goals: Heritage learners enhance their ability to use purpose-specific language (e.g., medical, educational fields) through community service
Learners develop three or more communication strategies reflecting cultural identity

In a 4-member team-based project, learners will address a given social issue (e.g., resolving community conflicts), document the collaborative process (role division, communication, feedback), and present 3+ problem-solving solutions in the final presentation. Evaluation comprises peer assessment (30%), instructor assessment (40%), and project deliverables (30%).

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
